{"step_by_step_thinking": "Alpha particles are large and carry a double positive charge. They are not very penetrating and a piece of paper can stop them. Beta particles are more penetrating than alpha particles, but still can be stopped by a sheet of aluminum. Electron beams are similar to beta particles in terms of penetration. Gamma rays, however, are extremely penetrating and can only be stopped by thick lead or concrete.", "answer_choice": "C"}
